CatDescriptText: Betty Culverson was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Out column published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 19, 1974, pg. 4. "[President] Ford presented an "inflation cure" to Congress which levies a five per cent income tax sur charge...Pittsburghers were asked to respond to this inflation cutting measure..." Answer reads: "We have too many taxes now.  How can a tax increase help to curb inflation.  We little persons are always the one who are directly affected by the moves of our government.  The big persons live off of the little ones.  Everything is going up, but our wages.  Soon we will actually be working for nothing."
TitMainTitle: Betty Culverson wearing long beaded earrings and trench coat, with building in background
